name: Transformers-for-NLP-2nd-Edition (Denis2054)
description: [é¡¹ç›®çº§] Transformer models from BERT to GPT-4, environments from Hugging Face to OpenAI. Fine-tuning, training, and prompt engineering examples. A bonus section with ChatGPT, GPT-3.5-turbo, GPT-4, and DALL-E including jump starting GPT-4, speech-to-text, text-to-speech, text to image generation with DALL-E, Google Cloud AI,HuggingGPT, and more ã€‚æ¥æº: https://github.com/Denis2054/Transformers-for-NLP-2nd-Edition

genes.title: é¡¹ç›®æ¦‚è¿°
genes.content:
Transformer models from BERT to GPT-4, environments from Hugging Face to OpenAI. Fine-tuning, training, and prompt engineering examples. A bonus section with ChatGPT, GPT-3.5-turbo, GPT-4, and DALL-E including jump starting GPT-4, speech-to-text, text-to-speech, text to image generation with DALL-E, Google Cloud AI,HuggingGPT, and more 

æ¥æº: https://github.com/Denis2054/Transformers-for-NLP-2nd-Edition

genes.content: You can run these notebooks on cloud platforms like [Google Colab](https://colab.research.google.com/) or your local machine. Note that some chapters require a GPU to run in a reasonable amount of time, so we recommend one of the cloud platforms as they come pre-installed with CUDA.

genes.title: æ ¸å¿ƒç‰¹æ€§
genes.content:
Implement models, such as BERT, Reformer, and T5, that outperform classical language models
Compare NLP applications using GPT-3, GPT-2, and other transformers
Analyze advanced use cases, including polysemy, cross-lingual learning, and computer vision. A GitHub BONUS directory with SOA ChatGPT, GPT-3.5-turbo, GPT-4, and DALL-E notebooks.
